argument.name: panelSettings
argument.description: Settings that define properties for the new panel. Can have the following properties:

property.name: name
property.description: The Name of the new Panel.

property.name: title
property.description: The title for the new Panel.

property.name: src
property.description: A panel card object that defines the contents of the Panel.

property.name: close
property.description: true/false. Adds close button to panel if true. For use with Panel Navigator with Tab Bands.

page.description: Adds a panel to a Panel Navigator

section.description: You can create Panels at run-time and dynamically add them to the Panel Navigator. The Panel Navigator's *[js:.addPanel()]* method can be called to add Panels. Similarly, you can remove Panels from a Panel Navigator at run-time.

section.title: Closing Dynamically Added Panel
section.description: If the dynamic panel is added to a Panel Navigator that has been configured to use Tab Bands as the method for navigating the child Panels, you can allow the user to close a dynamically added Panel. When the .addPanel() method is called, the JSON object that defines the new Panel can specify that the close button should be included by defining the *[js:close]* property in the panel settings object:

In the image below, Pane4 was added dynamically with the close option set to true. As you can see, the Tab Band label for the Pane includes a close icon. If you tap on the close icon, the Pane is closed and is removed from the Panel Navigator.
